result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tywann L. Lott

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM   Defendant Tywann L. Lott appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Tywann L. Lott.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin.  State filed joinder motion. Case not in trial posture; however, court has prepared for this motion. Court grants motion for joinder.  22CF288 is joined into 22CF218.  DE's SAR case pushed off - waiting for results of that case.   Adjmt granted.  FPT 12/14 930am. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. No such number. Unable to forward.
Final pre-trial on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

At the request of Attorney Corcoran and by agreement of ADA Huber and approval of Judge Dougvillo the JSH of 8/25/22 and JS of 8/29/22 will be adjourned; FPT scheduled for 8/9/22 is rescheduled to 10/12/22 at 10:00 am.  Victim rights compliance.

Minutes:  9:12am.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  22CF218/22CF288.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Jos. Corcoran.  VRC.  Defense requesting an adjournment of the FPT/JS dates.  Deft has been revoked - awaiting decision on his revocation.  In addition, Atty Corcoran having some issues reviewing the discovery.  No objection by the State.  FPT/State's motion for Joinder - 8/9/22 @ 8:30am, JSH - 8/25/22 @ 11:30am, JS 8/29/22 @ 9am.  NOTE - one of the State's witnesses is due to have a baby the first week of October.

Defendant Tywann L. Lott appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty. Joseph Corcoran  kmk
